SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.ckd

Interface SearchText

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlTokenSource
All Known Implementing Classes:
SearchTextImpl
public interface SearchText extends org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject
CKD text search configuration interface. Defines the contract for managing text search criteria within the Chronic Kidney Disease clinical decision support system. This interface provides comprehensive array manipulation capabilities for search terms and patterns used to identify CKD-relevant information in clinical documentation. The SearchText configuration enables: - Automated scanning of clinical notes for CKD terminology - Identification of kidney function-related laboratory values - Detection of nephrotoxic medications in medication lists - Recognition of CKD complications in clinical documentation - Discovery of family history of kidney disease Search terms can include: - Medical terminology (creatinine, GFR, proteinuria, etc.) - Drug names (ACE inhibitors, ARBs, diuretics, etc.) - Procedure codes (dialysis, transplant, biopsy, etc.) - Diagnostic patterns (chronic kidney disease, renal failure, etc.) The interface extends XMLBeans XmlObject to provide comprehensive XML serialization and deserialization capabilities for integration with EMR configuration systems.
Since:
2010-01-01

  • Method Details

    • getTextArray

      String[] getTextArray()
      Retrieves the complete array of text search criteria.
      Returns:
      String[] array containing all configured search terms and patterns for CKD-related text identification, may be empty but never null

    • getTextArray

      String getTextArray(int index)
      Retrieves a specific text search criterion by array index.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the search text to retrieve
      Returns:
      String the search text criterion at the specified index
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xgetTextArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] xgetTextArray()
      Retrieves the complete array of search text as XMLBeans XmlString objects. This method provides access to the underlying XMLBeans representation, preserving XML schema type information and validation capabilities for text search criteria.
      Returns:
      XmlString[] array of XMLBeans string objects containing search terms

    • xgetTextArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString xgetTextArray(int index)
      Retrieves a specific search text criterion as an XMLBeans XmlString object.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the search text
      Returns:
      XmlString XMLBeans object preserving type and validation information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • sizeOfTextArray

      int sizeOfTextArray()
      Returns the total number of configured text search criteria.
      Returns:
      int count of search text criteria in the array (0 or greater)

    • setTextArray

      void setTextArray(String[] searchTerms)
      Replaces the entire text search criteria array with new values. This method overwrites all existing search text configurations with the provided array. Use with caution as it will remove any previously configured search terms for CKD identification.
      Parameters:
      searchTerms - String[] new array of text search criteria to set

    • setTextArray

      void setTextArray(int index, String searchTerm)
      Updates a specific text search criterion at the given array index.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the search text to update
      searchTerm - String new text search criterion value
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xsetTextArray

      void xsetTextArray(org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] searchTerms)
      Replaces the entire text search array using XMLBeans XmlString objects. This method allows setting search text criteria while preserving XML schema type information and validation capabilities.
      Parameters:
      searchTerms - XmlString[] array of XMLBeans string objects

    • xsetTextArray

      void xsetTextArray(int index, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString searchTerm)
      Updates a specific search text criterion using an XMLBeans XmlString object.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the search text to update
      searchTerm - XmlString XMLBeans object with type and validation information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • insertText

      void insertText(int index, String searchTerm)
      Inserts a new text search criterion at the specified array position. All existing search text criteria at and after the specified index will be shifted one position to the right. The array size will increase by one.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based insertion position
      searchTerm - String text search criterion to insert

    • addText

      void addText(String searchTerm)
      Appends a new text search criterion to the end of the array. This is the most common method for adding new search terms to the CKD text search configuration. The new criterion will be added at the end of the existing array.
      Parameters:
      searchTerm - String text search criterion to add

    • insertNewText

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString insertNewText(int index)
      Inserts a new empty XMLBeans XmlString search criterion at the specified position. Creates and inserts a new XMLBeans XmlString object that can be populated with search text data while preserving XML schema validation.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based insertion position
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created XMLBeans object for population

    • addNewText

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString addNewText()
      Appends a new empty XMLBeans XmlString search criterion to the array. Creates and adds a new XMLBeans XmlString object at the end of the array that can be populated with search text data.
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created XMLBeans object for population

    • removeText

      void removeText(int index)
      Removes a text search criterion at the specified array index. All search text criteria after the removed element will be shifted one position to the left. The array size will decrease by one.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the search text to remove
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid
